files.summary: Contains: company founding story, early milestones, and growth narrative. Includes: founders Elena Vogel, Marko Petrovic, Sofia Rinaldi, first PoC, Munich HQ, Amsterdam & Vienna expansions.
Contains: wiki overview and navigation guide. Includes: links to background, mission, culture, hierarchy, systems, marketing, people, and offices sections.
Contains: organization hierarchy and reporting lines. Includes: CEO Elena, CTO Marko, COO Sofia, leads (Lukas, Klara, Jonas), and core team members list.
Contains: details of Munich headquarters. Includes: location, atmosphere, Munich‑based staff, rituals (Morning Drift, Kitchen Check‑In), and stories (Quiet Day, Surprise Cake).

Contains: description of Amsterdam branch. Includes: co‑working setting, staff (Klara, Timo, Helene), rituals (Café Stand‑Ups, Window Watching, Post‑Workshop Walks), and stories (Snow Day workshop, Napkin diagram).

Contains: cultural habits, rituals, and lore. Includes: informal tone, Demo Fridays, Aether‑Days, Wall of Quotes, decision principles, and myths (cat on keyboard, Amsterdam Snow Day, Vienna Night Shift).
Contains: mission, vision, and core values. Includes: fast prototyping, honesty over hype, small teams, human‑centered AI, sustainable pace, and risk awareness.
Contains: index of office pages. Includes: links to Munich, Amsterdam, and Vienna office files.
Contains: profile of Senior AI Engineer Ana Kovác. Includes: Munich location, NLP/LLM skills, aspirations, anecdotes, and collaboration notes.
Contains: marketing approach and brand style. Includes: conversation‑driven outreach, realistic case stories, community meetups, and minimalist visual identity.
Contains: profile of Software Engineer Timo van Dijk. Includes: Amsterdam location, backend focus, cloud deployment skills, anecdotes, and collaboration details.
Contains: profile of Software Engineer Mira Schäfer. Includes: Munich location, UI/API strengths, design anecdotes, aspirations, and team relationships.
Contains: profile of CTO Marko Petrovic. Includes: technical background, AI architecture expertise, philosophy, anecdotes, and cross‑team collaborations.
Contains: profile of CEO Elena Vogel. Includes: consulting background, leadership style, mission focus, anecdotes, and executive relationships.
Contains: profile of Lead AI Engineer Lukas Brenner. Includes: edge AI focus, vision/robotics interests, skill set, anecdotal lab stories, and team collaborations.
Contains: index of all employee profiles. Includes: sections for executive leadership, team leads, and core team with markdown links.
Contains: profile of Lead Consultant Jonas Weiss. Includes: workshop facilitation, consulting skills, anecdotes, and cross‑functional relationships.
Contains: profile of Consultant/Analyst Helene Stutz. Includes: documentation strengths, analytical skills, anecdotes, and role in workshops.
Contains: profile of Lead Software Engineer Klara Houtman. Includes: UI/architecture focus, backend expertise, playful design anecdotes, and team collaborations.
Contains: profile of AI Engineer Felix Baum. Includes: computer vision expertise, model optimization, anecdotal lighting diffuser story, and collaboration with Lukas.
Contains: profile of Operations Coordinator Richard Klein. Includes: coordination duties, time‑tracking improvements, anecdotes, and operational support role.
Contains: profile of COO Sofia Rinaldi. Includes: finance and ops background, risk management focus, anecdotes, and partnership with Elena and Marko.
Contains: definitions of core technical, consulting, collaboration, and personal skills. Includes: skill IDs (ml_engineering, llm_nlp, cv_engineering, etc.) and full names.
Contains: description of Vienna branch. Includes: lab location, hardware focus, staff (Lukas, Felix), rituals (Lab Hours, Coffee & Config), and stories (Night Shift, Mug Anomaly).
Contains: overview of internal systems. Includes: CRM, time & expense tracker, system dependency tracker, knowledge spaces, and cultural usage notes.
Contains: agent access policies, role permissions, data sensitivity classifications, safety rules, and public agent constraints. Includes: explicit MUST/MUST NOT rules and access controls.
